name: SBI PO (Probationary Officer)
description: A highly sought-after national-level recruitment examination conducted by the State Bank of India (SBI) for the selection of Probationary Officers. It is considered one of the most prestigious jobs in the banking sector in India, offering a promising career path.

eligibility.ageLimit: Between 21 and 30 years. Age relaxation is applicable for reserved categories (OBC, SC/ST, PwBD, etc.) as per government rules.
eligibility.educationalQualification: Graduation in any discipline from a recognised University or any equivalent qualification. Candidates in their final year/semester of their Graduation may also apply provisionally.
eligibility.numberOfAttempts: General/EWS: 4 attempts; General/EWS (PwD): 7 attempts; OBC/OBC (PwD): 7 attempts; SC/ST/SC(PwD)/ST(PwD): No restriction.

timeline.notificationDate: September 6, 2023 (for the 2023-24 cycle). The exam is conducted annually.
timeline.examDate: Preliminary Exam: November 1, 4, 6, 2023. Main Exam: December 5, 2023. Interview/GE: Jan-Feb 2024.
timeline.resultDate: The final result for the 2023-24 cycle was declared in March 2024.

examPattern.mode: Online (for Prelims & Mains), In-person (for GE & Interview)

stages.name: Phase-I: Preliminary Examination
stages.description: An online objective test for 100 marks with a duration of 1 hour (60 minutes). It consists of 3 sections with separate timings. This is a qualifying examination.

stages.name: Phase-II: Main Examination
stages.description: Consists of two parts conducted online: an Objective Test (200 marks) and a Descriptive Test (50 marks, 30 mins). Marks from both are considered for shortlisting for the final stage.

stages.name: Phase-III: Psychometric Test, Group Exercise & Interview
stages.description: Candidates undergo a Psychometric test (qualifying). The final selection phase includes a Group Exercise (20 marks) and an Interview (30 marks). The final merit list is based on Mains and Phase-III marks.

examPattern.markingScheme: For objective tests (Prelims and Mains), 1/4th (or 0.25) of the mark assigned to a question will be deducted for each incorrect answer.

syllabus.name: Main Exam: Data Analysis & Interpretation
topics: Advanced Data Interpretation (Tabular, Bar, Line, Pie, Caselet)

syllabus.name: Main Exam: General/ Economy/ Banking Awareness

latestUpdate.title: SBI PO 2024 Notification is expected to be released around September 2024.

books.title: A Modern Approach to Verbal & Non-Verbal Reasoning
books.author: R.S. Aggarwal
